snippet: To the Editor:    Contrary to ''Affirmative Action in Play'' (editorial, Nov. 6), the Supreme Court did not ''sidestep'' anything by refusing to hear a challenge to California's Proposition 209, the anti-affirmative action initiative. It simply de...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Contrary to ''Affirmative Action in Play'' (editorial, Nov. 6), the Supreme Court did not ''sidestep'' anything by refusing to hear a challenge to California's Proposition 209, the anti-affirmative action initiative. It simply decided not to decide. That constitutes a legitimate decision.
abstract: Arthur M Yoss letter disputes November 6 editorial, which asserted that US Supreme Court sidestepped issues by refusing to hear challenge to California's afffirmative action proposition (S)
